citations.narrative:
On the morning of December 12, 2024, a 4.5-year-old female greater flamingo was found deceased in her housing area.
Records, including a surveillance video of the bobcat with the flamingo, indicate the flamingo was predated by a bobcat
early that morning. Since the incident, additional security measures have been implemented to protect the flamingos
housed in this area.
On the morning of December 16, 2024, an approximately 9-year-old male magpie goose was found deceased within his
habitat. Medical records, including a necropsy report, and discussions with facility personnel indicate the wounds
sustained by the magpie are consistent with those from a predator.
Since this incident, there have been no birds housed in this area.
Failure to maintain the bird enclosures in a manner which adequately protects all the facility’s birds such as ensuring
enclosures are predator proof may lead to potential injury, harm, or death. Housing facilities for birds must be designed
and constructed so that they are structurally sound for the species of bird housed in them. They must be kept in good
repair, protect the birds from injury, and restrict other animals from entering that may negatively affect their welfare.
Correct from this day, 02/27/25, forward

On December 30, 2024, a 6.5-year-old female red-flank duiker was found deceased within her outdoor habitat. The night
before, keepers were unable to bring her into her night quarters as she was hiding under a bridge, and due to human
safety factors, could not bring her in. Records and discussion with facility personnel indicate that based on the
characteristic traumatic lesions noted on her body, scavenging and sightings of bobcats in the area, predation was likely
the cause of death.
Records show since the incident, the facility has increased deterrents, met with state wildlife officials to assist with permits
to trap and relocate the bobcats, and have established a wildlife coexistence work group.
Failure to maintain the duiker habitat in a manner which adequately protects all the animals housed within such as
ensuring enclosures are predator proof may lead to potential injury, harm or death. Animal housing facilities must protect
animals from injury, harm, and death.
Correct from this day, 02/27/25, forward
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.150(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
On the morning of December 12, 2024, a 4.5-year-old female greater flamingo was found deceased in her housing area. 
Records, including a surveillance video of the bobcat with the flamingo, indicate the flamingo was predated by a bobcat 
early that morning. Since the incident, additional security measures have been implemented to protect the flamingos 
housed in this area.  
 
On the morning of December 16, 2024, an approximately 9-year-old male magpie goose was found deceased within his 
habitat. Medical records, including a necropsy report, and discussions with facility personnel indicate the wounds 
sustained by the magpie are consistent with those from a predator.  
Since this incident, there have been no birds housed in this area.  
 
Failure to maintain the bird enclosures in a manner which adequately protects all the facility’s birds such as ensuring 
enclosures are predator proof may lead to potential injury, harm, or death. Housing facilities for birds must be designed 
and constructed so that they are structurally sound for the species of bird housed in them. They must be kept in good 
repair, protect the birds from injury, and restrict other animals from entering that may negatively affect their welfare.  
Correct from this day, 02/27/25, forward 
3.125(a)  Critical Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
On December 30, 2024, a 6.5-year-old female red-flank duiker was found deceased within her outdoor habitat. The night 
before, keepers were unable to bring her into her night quarters as she was hiding under a bridge, and due to human 
safety factors, could not bring her in. Records and discussion with facility personnel indicate that based on the 
characteristic traumatic lesions noted on her body, scavenging and sightings of bobcats in the area, predation was likely 
the cause of death.  
Records show since the incident, the facility has increased deterrents, met with state wildlife officials to assist with permits 
to trap and relocate the bobcats, and have established a wildlife coexistence work group. 
Failure to maintain the duiker habitat in a manner which adequately protects all the animals housed within such as 
ensuring enclosures are predator proof may lead to potential injury, harm or death. Animal housing facilities must protect

animals from injury, harm, and death. 
Correct from this day, 02/27/25, forward 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
